device.label: XBee Smart Plug
device.description: XBee SmartPlug with Power Management device.

setting.label: XBee Device Manager
setting.tooltip: Must be set to the name of an XBeeDeviceManager instance.

setting.label: MAC Address
setting.tooltip: The extended address of the XBee device you would like to monitor.

setting.label: Sample rate
setting.tooltip: The sample rate of the XBee SmartPlug in milliseconds.

setting.label: Default state
setting.tooltip: "On"/"Off"/"Same", if "On" the plug will default to being switched on.

setting.label: IDLE Off seconds
setting.tooltip: Number of seconds to go by before forcing power off. If not set the value defaults to 0, which means the device never idles out.

setting.label: Power On source
setting.tooltip: String name of a Boolean "device.channel" to be used as the state. For example, if set to the name of a channel which changes value from False to True, the SmartPlug would change from being off to on.

setting.label: Power Factor adjustment
setting.tooltip: Floating point value between 0 and 1, that is used to adjust the current output given a known power factor. Defaults to 1 (i.e no adjustment)\r\nNote: The unit cannot determine the pf, it is strictly a user supplied value.

setting.label: Device profile
setting.tooltip: String value corresponding to a preset pf_adjustment value. These values are by no means meant to be precise, and are at best ballpark estimates. For a list of the available devices, see the check_profiles function below. For more accuracy, use the pf_adjustment setting above. If both pf_adjustment and device_profile are set, only pf_adjustment is used.
